Lw0lDFmkymA#7#PL_oohi_O51Z_lORk8SCG_4x1s: I'm glad to have the chance to speak again to The Independent Community Bankers of America even if it's by the way of pre-recorded remarks this will be the first time in quite a few years that I haven't been with you in person but if you may know the Federal Open Market Committee met yes yesterday in Washington so I'm unable to join you in Nashville

I very much enjoyed attending these annual icpa get-togethers especially since I get the chance to hear directly from you about what's happening in your local economies and it Community banking more generally it's a tradition I hope to re-establish in the future

Community Banks remain a critical component of our financial system and our economy they help keep their local economies vibrant and growing by taking on and managing the risks of local lending which larger Banks may be unwilling or unable to do
they often respond with greater agility to lending request than their National
